client.controller
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  client.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener

Controller Class communicates between client model and the graphical user interface (view). Handles events occuring in the gui and calls the appropriate methods in the client. The method displayMessage() is also by the client to communicate with the gui.

          Constructor the controller.

Constructor Detail

Controller

public Controller(Gui gui)
Constructor the controller. Makes actionlisteners, keylisteners and windowslisteners of the components of the graphical userinterface refer to this class. ActionListeners react to the buttons clicked in the gui, windowslistener reacts when the user closes the window (correctly unregisters the user if he is still connected), and the keylistener reacts when typing a new message in the edit-field.

Parameters:
gui -
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Makes the GUI visible to the user

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
Handles actions occurring in the gui. Differentiates between the components and performs the required action for this component.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent ke)
Reacts on the keys pressed by the user while he is typing in the edit-field. If he hits return, the message is sent to the server and the edit-field is cleared.

Specified by:
keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent arg0)
Method has to be there when implementing a keylistener interface, but the method is not used in this project.

Specified by:
keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

displayMessage

public void displayMessage(Message msg)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method displays a message on the textarea-component in the user interface. It builds a string from the data in the message object, and appends it to the content in the textarea.

Parameters:
msg -
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

throwErrorMessage

public void throwErrorMessage(java.lang.String s)
This method creates a new Window for an error message, and displays the text of the string s.

Parameters:
s -
